top_insights: Switching rate is critical: 159.8 switches/hour on average (normal 20-40; critical >100), with a peak of 344/hour.
Sessions are micro-fragmented: average session is 1.8 minutes; 48.6% are <0.9 min, only 12.5% exceed 3.6 min.
App/task sprawl is high: 83 unique windows detected, a strong driver of attention residue and reactivation costs.
Work is spread thin: 3.52 hours logged across 8 active hours, increasing restart friction and perceived effort.
Circadian pattern: no evening work (good), but 10.3% of activity occurs before 7 AM, which can strain sleep if not compensated.

flags.message: Average switching rate 159.8/hr (4x normal; above the 100+/hr critical threshold) with a peak of 344/hr indicates severe context thrashing.
flags.prescription: Schedule 3 daily 45-minute Focus blocks where an app/website blocker allows only your primary work app; all notifications off and non-essential apps blocked.

flags.message: Average session length is 1.8 minutes with 48.6% of sessions under 0.9 minutes and only 12.5% over 3.6 minutes—insufficient sustained focus or restorative breaks.
flags.prescription: Adopt two daily ultradian cycles for 1 week: each cycle = 2 × 25-minute focus sprints with 5-minute micro-breaks, then a 15-minute recovery break.

flags.message: 83 unique windows suggest excessive app/tab churn, inflating attention residue and decision fatigue.
flags.prescription: Work in a single dedicated desktop per task and cap active windows at 3; move all other windows to a separate desktop opened only during breaks.

flags.message: 3.52 hours of work distributed across 8 active hours implies frequent reactivation costs and all-day vigilance.
flags.prescription: Timebox into two contiguous work blocks (AM and early PM) totaling 3.5–4.5 hours; restrict email/Slack to two 15-minute windows (e.g., 11:30 and 16:30).

flags.message: 10.3% of activity occurs before 7 AM; while evening work is 0%, pre-7 AM work can truncate sleep and degrade cognitive control.
flags.prescription: Avoid pre-7:00 AM work for the next 14 days; anchor wake time within ±30 minutes and get 10–15 minutes of outdoor light within 1 hour of waking.

flags.message: Recent spike: 86 switches in 15 minutes (~344/hr) suggests notification storms or multitasking under pressure.
flags.prescription: When switches exceed 60 in 15 minutes, trigger a 3-minute reset: step away, take 10 slow breaths, write one next action, then resume the single task.
